newsitem.title: ALBANIA: French advance units arrive in Albania.
newsitem.headline: French advance units arrive in Albania.

text.p: The first French troops joining an international security mission to Albania arrived in the western port city of Durres on Sunday, witnesses said.
Forty French soldiers from the ship Chamberlain disembarked after sailing across the Adriatic from the Italian port of Brindisi. Another 100 troops remained on board.
They joined 100 Italian soldiers who arrived on Friday and are among the vanguard of a 6,000-strong U.N.-backed force charged with protecting aid convoys.
The commander of the French ship, Herve Gourmelon told reporters his mission was to pave the way for another 450 French troops due to reach Durres on Tuesday.
Gourmelon said the 40 would work with advance Italian units that arrived on Friday to the secure Durres-Tirana main road.
France is providing a 1,000-strong contingent to the multinational force led by Italy that is expected to begin full-scale deployment in Albania next week to assist in a relief mission.
Romania, Greece, Turkey, Spain, Austria and Denmark are also sending troops.
